programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It Pittsburgh!: Thrill of the Grill
programme.desc: In this battle of the grill, Chef Todd Cassell and Chef Alekka Sweeney face-off to see who can bring home the bragging rights with their Pittsburgh inspired dishes.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Super Rare Stolen Treasures
programme.desc: From a 300-year-old violin valued at $6 million, to thousands of rare books, thieves will go to wild, even dangerous, lengths to snatch up irreplaceable treasures. For investigators, it's a race against the clock to recover these priceless valuables.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Decades-old cold cases are finally solved thanks to advances in DNA technology.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Can Chef Colton Colburn-Wood of Cosmica in Boston trip up Chef Erin Miller of Urban Hearth in Cambridge? Both chefs skillfully build simple to complex foundations. But who will correctly replicate and get theirs plated in time?

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.sub-title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Teaching STEM to the next generation is opening a new world of possibilities for career opportunities, connection and inspiration.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Killings That Shook a College Community
programme.desc: A young boy and his family's housekeeper are brutally killed in an upscale Omaha neighborhood. Their case goes cold for years, until another double homicide reveals the link and unmasks a serial killer.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.sub-title: Ballin' in Baltimore: Baseball Legend Ryan Ripken Pitches Angel a Day of Iconic Institutions
programme.desc: Angel joins baseball legend, Ryan Ripken, for a home run day, exploring the best of Baltimore. They bat 100 at Ripken Stadium, learn about sea life at the National Aquarium, crush indoor rock climbing and show down in an epic cook-off.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: These days, cameras are everywhere. Those up to no good can run, but Big Brother is always watching.

programme.title: Ethan: The Miracle Dog
programme.desc: Follow one dog's journey to recovery, a forever home and eventually, stardom.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From nail art to astronaut boots these people love what they do for a living

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Re-creating Black Garlic Porkchop vs. Pork Belly Leeks Three Ways
programme.desc: In this battle, it’s a sizzling pork showdown. Chef Travis Chasteen of RusTeak in Thornton Park faces off with Chef John Collazo of Bad A's Sandwiches in the Milk District. It’s Pork Belly vs. Tomahawk on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: More Than A Feeling
programme.desc: Heart, soul and sauce overfloweth when Chef Linda Green (a.k.a. “The Yakamein Lady”) goes up against Chef Estrada from the House of Blues. When you’ve got two chefs who pack a plate with this much love, there are no losers.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.sub-title: Wait, What Happened?: Are Dead Butterflies Walking?
programme.desc: Why is Frank Nicotero sumo wrestling at a farmer's market? Find out as he quizzes Queen City locals about the wildest, wackiest news stories as they try for cash prizes.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It!: Scratch Bake Boss Takes on Sweet Potato Prince in Great Baltimore Bake- Off
programme.desc: Queen of Cupcakes Chef Sumayyah Bilal is up against Pound Cake King Tre-von Clark in this royal bake-off. Which chef will take the cake? And who will be burned by the competition?

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.sub-title: What's On The Menu, Baltimore? Comfort Food
programme.desc: Loosen that belt: Today we're filling up on comforting classics. From thick focaccia pizza to the juiciest smoked brisket, we guarantee there won't be room for dessert.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: Unmasking The Golden State Killer
programme.desc: The Golden State Killer, also known as the East Area Rapist, remained a mystery for years.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the ‘Burgh: Made by Hand in the Southside
programme.desc: Ed and Day try their hand at pottery and make pretzels in a 150 year old oven before toasting their day at Carson Street Deli & Craft Beer Bar in the Southside.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.sub-title: Sports Town Stories: Baltimore Invests in the Next Generation
programme.desc: From ice hockey to lacrosse to tennis, Baltimore coaches help drive the next generation to find family, inspiration and pride through sports.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Drake Diner Slayings
programme.desc: It's the day after Thanksgiving 1992 in Drake, Iowa, and few want to cook. Locals head to the popular Drake Diner instead. In front of a packed restaurant, an armed man shoots and kills two diner employees. Is the town as peaceful as some say?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Spin and Shag in Greer, SC
programme.desc: Near the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, go for a spin on the track and on the dance floor. Order a tiny coffee and get cozy in a tiny house. Chat up alpacas and introduce yourself to the granddaughter of a legendary four-legged athlete. It’s all possible in Greer, South Carolina.

programme.title: Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild
programme.desc: "Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild," examines the lives impacted in the hours, days and months following the collapse, telling the stories of first responders, workers at the Port of Baltimore, business owners and employees, and the people living in nearby communities.

programme.title: Searching for Johnny
programme.desc: (2022) The disappearance of Johnny Gosch is one of Iowa's longest running, and most notorious mysteries. In 1982, the 12-year-old paperboy in West Des Moines vanished without a trace. Forty years later, KCCI uncovers where the investigation stands.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Old School Classics From The Midwest that Stood the Test of Time
programme.desc: Indulge in the old-school classics that have reigned in the Midwest for decades. From Wisconsin cheese curds to Kansas City's burnt ends, enjoy these unique comfort foods that are as timeless as they are tasty.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.sub-title: My Perfect Day with Woman's Day: Grandmothers Pinky-Promise to Self Care
programme.desc: Karla, a devoted mother and doting grandmother has had her fair share of obstacles from two bouts of cancer to caring for her husband and daughter. Karla embarks on a much needed day of pampering, seeking solace and self-care.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From professional hockey players to award-winning muralists, The Spark highlights the craft, the journey, and the joy. These masters and thought leaders may have made names for themselves on the national stage, but they never forget the city that sparks their inspiration daily

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Baltimore: Who Will Win the Battle of the Bay?
programme.desc: Chefs Sean Guy and Amy Hessel compete in this seafood showdown, the ultimate Battle of the Bay. Who will walk away with the title Captain of the Chesapeake?

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: In “Free Spirit,” award-winning bartender and host Kate Gerwin takes to the road and meets people in their workplaces and their favorite watering holes.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.sub-title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild
programme.desc: "Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild," examines the lives impacted in the hours, days and months following the collapse, telling the stories of first responders, workers at the Port of Baltimore, business owners and employees, and the people living in nearby communities.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.sub-title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.
